user.comment: Options: pro, max5x, max20x - Set this to your Claude subscription plan

weekly.comment: Weekly cost limits in USD for each plan tier. NOTE: pro and max5x limits are estimated/unverified - only max20x has been tested

limits.comment: Context limit (in thousands), cost limit per 5-hour session, token limit for tracking

paths.comment: Path to your Claude Code projects directory

display.comment: Display settings: progress bar length, lines to read from transcript, minutes for active session detection

colors.comment: ANSI color codes for statusline elements. Use '2;' prefix for dim, '1;' for bright. Available: orange, bright_orange, dim_orange, red, dim_red, pink, dim_pink, bright_pink, green, purple, cyan, dim_blue.

layer1.comment: Layer 1: 0-0.3x of cost_limit (base threshold). Thresholds calculated as: cost_limit × multiplier.

layer2.comment: Layer 2: 0.3x-0.5x of cost_limit. Visual scale auto-calculated for each layer.

layer3.comment: Layer 3: 0.5x-1.0x of cost_limit. Multipliers define threshold relative to base limit.

multi_layer.comment: 5-hour window layers. Base threshold = cost_limit. Layer thresholds = base × threshold_multiplier. Visual scaling auto-calculated per layer.

layer1.comment: Layer 1: 0-1.0x of base (weekly_limit/7 or recommend value). Base changes dynamically with mode.

layer2.comment: Layer 2: 1.0x-1.5x of base. Base is weekly_limit/7 (static) or recommend value (dynamic mode).

daily_layer.comment: Daily usage layers. Base threshold = weekly_limit/7 (static mode) or recommend value (dynamic mode when weekly recommend enabled). Layer thresholds = base × threshold_multiplier. Visual scaling auto-calculated per layer.

layer1.comment: Layer 1: 0-1.0x of context_limit. Normal usage range with dimmed pink color.

layer2.comment: Layer 2: 1.0x-2.0x of context_limit. Elevated usage with dimmed orange color.

layer3.comment: Layer 3: 2.0x-3.0x of context_limit. High usage with dimmed red color.

context_layer.comment: Context window layers. Base threshold = context_limit. Layer thresholds = base × threshold_multiplier. Allows tracking beyond nominal limit. Visual scaling auto-calculated per layer.

sections.comment: Toggle visibility of statusline sections - set to false to hide any section. show_directory: project name (default on, bold bright orange). show_five_hour_window: 5-hour cost window ($X/$Y [bar] %). show_daily: daily cycle tracker. show_weekly: weekly percentage. show_monthly: monthly total cost. show_timer: reset countdown. show_token_rate: current token burn rate (tokens/min). show_sessions: active session count. weekly_display_mode: 'usage' (shows weekly usage %), 'avail' (shows available % left with label 'avail'), 'recommend' (shows recommended daily usage % to finish allocated budget with label 'recom').

tracking.comment: Weekly tracking: 'ccusage' (default, uses ISO weeks) or 'ccusage_r' (optional, matches Anthropic console schedule). To use ccusage_r: set official_reset_date from your console's 'Resets [date/time]' (format: 2025-10-08T15:00:00-07:00 for 'Oct 8, 3pm Vancouver'). payment_cycle_start_date: optional, set to track monthly cost from your billing cycle start (format: 2025-10-01T15:00:00-07:00 - date is cycle start, time is copied from official_reset_date for consistency). weekly_baseline_percent compensates for untracked costs from deleted transcripts (clear/compact commands) - set to the percentage gap between your Anthropic console and statusline (e.g., console 15% vs statusline 10% → set to 5). cache_duration_seconds controls how long ccusage_r results are cached (default: 300 = 5 minutes). See README for setup guide.
